item.title: 中国 7 月银行贷款将下降，中国政府将继续关注政策支持
item.description: 路透社周五的一项民意调查显示，尽管中国央行加大了对经济的政策支持力度，但受信贷需求不振和季节性因素的拖累，中国7月份新增人民币贷款可能环比大幅下降。【原文：China's new yuan loans likely fell sharply in July from the previous month, a Reuters poll showed on Friday, dragged down by tepid credit demand and seasonal factors even as the central bank steps up policy support for the economy.】

item.title: 德国工会与汉莎航空发现者航空公司达成工资协议
item.description: 德国工会威尔第（Verdi）周五表示，它已与汉莎航空旗下的发现航空公司（Discover Airlines）达成工资协议，驾驶舱和客舱乘务员的工资最高将增加 38%。【原文：German union Verdi said on Friday it has reached a wage agreement with Lufthansa's Discover Airlines that will increase the salaries of cockpit and cabin crew by up to 38%.】

item.title: 随着国内航空公司向海外扩张，外国航空公司对中国失去兴趣
item.description: 行业数据显示，由于中国旅游需求疲软、成本上升以及需要避开俄罗斯领空导致飞行时间延长，外国竞争对手望而却步，中国航空公司在国际航线上的市场份额不断扩大。【原文：Chinese airlines are gaining market share on international routes, industry data shows, as foreign rivals are deterred by weak China travel demand and rising costs and extended flight times because of the need to avoid Russian airspace.】

item.title: 市场可能在招手，而不是溺水：迈克-多兰
item.description: 看似混乱的金融市场可能只是正常化，最终将有助于保护投资组合，而不是将其置于死地。【原文：What looks like a financial market in disarray may instead just be normalization that will ultimately help insulate investment portfolios rather than sending them to the ground.】

item.title: 美国零售商担心罢工和干扰，抢购节假日进口商品
item.description: 零售商正在推动今年夏天的美国进口热潮，因为各公司都在防范可能发生的港口工人罢工，以及在假日购物季缩短之前红海袭击事件造成的持续航运中断。【原文：Retailers are fueling a summer rush of imports to the United States this year, as companies guard against a potential port workers strike and ongoing shipping disruptions from attacks in the Red Sea ahead of a shortened holiday shopping season.】

item.title: 全球石油需求需要更快增长才能消化欧佩克+的涨幅
item.description: 据数据、分析师和业内人士称，未来几个月全球石油需求增长需要加快，否则市场将难以消化欧佩克+计划从 10 月份开始增加的石油供应。【原文：Global oil demand growth needs to accelerate in coming months or the market will struggle to absorb an increase in oil supply that OPEC+ is planning to make from October, according to data, analysts and industry sources.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，中国要求部分券商对债券交易进行合规性检查
item.description: 三位知情人士称，中国证券监管机构已下令一些券商检查其债券交易活动，因为当局正试图控制对中国政府债券的疯狂购买。【原文：China's securities regulator has ordered some brokerages to inspect their bond trading activities, three people with knowledge of the matter said, as authorities seek to rein in frenzied buying of Chinese government bonds.】

item.title: 衰退风险扰动市场，但尚不令人担忧
item.description: 令人失望的美国就业数据动摇了人们对全球最大经济体软着陆的信心，导致全球股市暴跌，降息押注激增。【原文：Disappointing U.S. jobs data has shaken confidence in a soft landing for the world's largest economy, sending global equity markets tumbling and bets on interest rate cuts surging.】

item.title: 早间竞标动荡的一周在高潮中结束
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu.】

item.title: 印度顶级电动摩托车制造商 Ola Electric 首次亮相就表现平平
item.description: 软银支持的欧拉电动汽车公司（Ola Electric Mobility）股价在周五开盘前的交易中表现平平，原因是人们担心这家亏损公司能否保住市场份额并实现其电池生产项目。【原文：SoftBank-backed Ola Electric Mobility's shares debuted flat in pre-open trade on Friday amid concerns about the loss-making company's ability to retain its market share and deliver on its battery cell manufacturing project.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，ByteDance 将寻求 50 亿美元贷款的再融资
item.description: 据彭博社周五援引知情人士的话报道，Tiktok 的所有者 Bytedance 正准备将 50 亿美元的贷款再融资三年。【原文：Tiktok-owner Bytedance is preparing to refinance a $5 billion loan by another three years, Bloomberg news reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，迪士尼将在欧洲和英国斥资 50 亿美元制作新大片
item.description: 迪斯尼公司欧洲、中东和非洲地区总裁 Jan Koeppen 周五告诉《金融时报》，迪斯尼计划在未来五年内在英国和欧洲大陆投入至少 50 亿美元制作大片和电视节目。【原文：Disney plans to spend at least $5 billion in the UK and continental Europe over the next five years to produce blockbuster movies and TV shows, Jan Koeppen, its president across Europe, Middle East and Africa, told the Financial Times on Friday.】

item.title: 从百事可乐到宝洁，印度成为下一个增长赌注，而中国则落在后面
item.description: 印度已成为百事可乐、联合利华和其他包装商品巨头的下一个重要赌注，它们希望填补中国不均衡复苏留下的增长真空。【原文：India has become the next big bet for PepsiCo, Unilever and other packaged goods giants looking to fill the growth vacuum left by an uneven recovery in China.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将以高位结束残酷的一周，日元面临压力
item.description: 随着日本股市接近收复周一的全部巨大损失，亚洲股市以高位结束了本周的艰难走势，而由于市场降低了美国大幅降息的可能性，日元再次下滑。【原文：Asian shares are ending a rough week on a high as Japanese stocks are close to recouping all of the huge losses from Monday, while the yen slipped again as markets pared back the chance of an outsized U.S. rate cut.】

item.title: 全球石化企业在供过于求的危机中塑造形象
item.description: 欧洲和亚洲的石化生产商正处于生死存亡的关头，因为第一大市场中国多年来的产能扩张和欧洲高昂的能源成本已经连续三年压低了利润率，迫使企业进行整合。【原文：Petrochemical producers in Europe and Asia are in survival mode as years of capacity build-up in top market China and high energy costs in Europe have depressed margins for three consecutive years, forcing firms to consolidate.】

item.title: 适者生存：石化产品制造商应对全球供应过剩
item.description: 欧洲和亚洲的石化生产商正处于生死存亡的关头，因为第一大市场中国多年来的产能扩张和欧洲高昂的能源成本已经连续两年压低了利润率，迫使企业进行整合。【原文：Petrochemical producers in Europe and Asia are in survival mode as years of capacity build-up in top market China and high energy costs in Europe have depressed margins for two consecutive years, forcing firms to consolidate.】

item.title: 中国 7 月居民消费价格上涨快于预期，生产者通货紧缩依然存在
item.description: 随着中国政府在经济复苏乏力的情况下加大对脆弱的消费部门的支持力度，中国 7 月份的消费价格上涨速度超过了预期，而生产者通货紧缩依然存在。【原文：China's consumer prices rose at a faster-than-expected rate in July, while producer deflation persisted, as Beijing ramps up support for its frail consumer sector in the face of a sputtering economic recovery.】

item.title: 就业形势缓解，美元接近一周高位；日元下跌
item.description: 周五，美元兑主要对手货币徘徊在一周高位附近，此前美国申请失业救济人数创下近一年来的最大降幅，缓解了人们对经济衰退迫在眉睫的担忧。【原文：The dollar hovered close to a one-week high against major rivals on Friday, after the biggest drop in U.S. jobless claims in close to a year allayed fears of a looming economic downturn.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势加剧，美国前景向好，石油周涨幅将达 3
item.description: 周五亚市早盘，油价有所回落，但本周有望上涨3%以上，原因是美国就业数据平息了需求担忧，而且对中东冲突扩大的担忧持续存在。【原文：Oil prices edged down in early Asian trading on Friday but were on track to gain more than 3% for the week as U.S. jobs data calmed demand concerns and fears of a widening Middle East conflict persisted.】

item.title: 据国家媒体报道，中国债券交易账户不得借用或转让
item.description: 一家央行下属报纸称，中国银行间债券市场交易账户不得借用或转让，否则可能导致违规交易增加，扭曲市场价格，增加信贷风险。【原文：China's interbank bond market trading accounts must not be borrowed or transferred, as that could lead to a rise in non-compliant transactions, distort market prices and increase credit risks, a central bank-affiliated newspaper said.】

item.title: 日元的狂野之旅：涨跌与日本央行干预
item.description: 过去几年，由于市场关注美日利差过大，日元一直承受着压力。【原文：The Japanese yen has been under pressure in the past few years as markets focused on the wide U.S.-Japan interest rate differentials.】

item.title: 澳大利亚电视公司 Foxtel 被新闻集团出售
item.description: 澳大利亚付费电视公司 Foxtel 由默多克家族控制，部分股权由当地电信公司 Telstra 持有，其所有者新闻集团（News Corp）周四表示，由于第三方的兴趣和战略审查，该公司已被出售。【原文：Australian pay television company Foxtel, controlled by the Murdoch family and partly by local telecom firm Telstra , has been put up for sale post third-party interest and a strategic review, owner News Corp said on Thursday.】

item.title: 穆迪下调英特尔高级无担保评级
item.description: 穆迪（Moody's）周四将英特尔的高级无担保评级从之前的 A3 下调至 BAA1，理由是担心这家芯片制造商的盈利能力。【原文：Moody's downgraded Intel's senior unsecured rating on Thursday to BAA1 from its earlier A3 rating, citing concerns about the chipmaker's profitability.】

item.title: 美联储施密德表示更有信心通胀率达到 2% 的目标
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）是美国央行中较为鹰派的决策者之一，他在周四表示，最近 "令人鼓舞 "的数据让他对通胀降温更有信心，并为美联储降息做好了准备。【原文：Kansas City Federal Reserve Bank President Jeff Schmid, one of the U.S. central bank's more hawkish policymakers, said on Thursday that recent "encouraging" data gives him more confidence that inflation is cooling and sets the table for a reduction in the Fed's interest rate.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长称将 "不惜一切代价 "控制通胀
item.description: 巴西央行货币政策主管加布里埃尔-加里波洛（Gabriel Galipolo）周四表示，巴西央行将 "不惜一切代价 "控制通胀，并补充说通胀风险似乎高于其3%的目标。【原文：Brazil's central bank will do "whatever is necessary" to control inflation, monetary policy director Gabriel Galipolo said on Thursday, adding that risks appeared to be to the upside of its 3% target.】

item.title: 早间竞标：乐观情绪升温，但中国通胀迫在眉睫
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 由于国际旅游需求持续增长，Expedia 第二季度利润超出预期
item.description: 受国际旅游需求持续增长的影响，在线旅行社 Expedia 周四公布的第二季度利润超出分析师预期，盘后股价上涨 7%。【原文：Online travel agency Expedia beat analysts' expectations on Thursday for second-quarter profit, helped by sustained demand for international travel, sending its shares up 7% after the bell.】

item.title: 芝加哥联储古尔斯比表示，美联储对经济数据而非政治或股票作出反应
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周四重申，央行的工作不是应对股市溃败或政治因素【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Austan Goolsbee on Thursday reiterated that the central bank's job is not to respond to stock market routs or political considerations】

item.title: 新闻集团第四季度收入超出预期
item.description: 受道琼斯商业信息部门数字订阅增长的帮助，媒体集团新闻集团周四公布的第四季度营收超出华尔街预期。【原文：Media conglomerate News Corp beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue on Thursday, helped by digital subscription growth at its Dow Jones business information unit.】

item.title: Take-Two Interactive 预测第二季度预订额低于预期，原因是游戏支出疲软
item.description: 视频游戏出版商 Take-Two Interactive Software 周四预测第二季度预订额低于华尔街预期，这表明在经济不确定的情况下，其《侠盗猎车手》和《NBA 2K》等热门游戏的消费疲软。【原文：Videogame publisher Take-Two Interactive Software forecast second-quarter bookings below Wall Street expectations on Thursday, a sign of sluggish spending on its popular titles such as "Grand Theft Auto" and "NBA 2K" in an uncertain economy.】
